text:
An underappreciated near-future dynamic is one where human surveillance state capitalism is replaced by an AGI panopticon…

Where every packet is sniffed by networks of autonomous LLMs, hungry for every digital morsel…

Where the internet becomes a dark forest…

We need to be building tools now (a la @jack ) to keep lit the fragile flame of human sovereignty… 

“The mathematicians who participated had to sign a nondisclosure agreement requiring them to communicate solely via the messaging app Signal. Other forms of contact, such as traditional e-mail, could potentially be scanned by an LLM and inadvertently train it, thereby contaminating the dataset.”

text:
Bill Pulte (FHFA attack dog), former Governor Kevin Warsh, NEC head Kevin Hassett, Vance, & Trump have each publicly framed the $2.5B Fed-HQ renovation as evidence of Powell’s “mismanagement,” signalling a choreographed effort to depict the overrun as statutory “cause” for dismissal.

Under 12 U.S.C. § 242–244, a Board member “may be removed *for cause* by the President,” and any vacancy in the Chair is automatically filled by the Vice Chair—presently Philip Jefferson—until a new Chair is Senate-confirmed.

If Trump fires Powell (which would conveniently move the news cycle off of Epstein), JP would likely seek an immediate injunction, arguing that Humphrey’s Executor v. US protects multi-member independent-agency governors from at-will removal, but this clash would test that precedent in light of recent cases (Seila Law and Collins).

While courts weigh the challenge, the WH must nominate a successor and navigate Senate Banking hearings (or consider a recess appointment).

We could thus have a situation with:

A Fired Fed Chair appealing for reinstatement, 
An Acting Fed Chair that nobody has ever heard of, and
A Shadow Fed Chair eager to telegraph a very different policy direction.

Imagine the policy vol in that environment….

Bitcoin is sniffing something out…
